title: Laura Niles
text:
Laura Niles is an American <a href="model%20%28profession%29">model</a>, <a href="actress">actress</a>, comedian, <a href="Martial%20arts">martial artist</a>, and <a href="Boxing">boxer</a>.
Career.
Acting.
Niles acting career started in 2004 with appearances on "<a href="The%20Best%20Damn%20Sports%20Show%20Period">The Best Damn Sports Show Period</a>" as "Santa's Helper". Since then she has appeared in a variety of minor roles, guest appearances, and <a href="Bit%20part">walk-on role</a>s that include the television series' "<a href="Gun%20X%20Sword">Gun X Sword</a>" (2005), <a href="Perfect%2010%20%28magazine%29">Perfect 10 Model Boxing</a> (2006), "<a href="Gay%2C%20Straight%20or%20Taken%3F">Gay, Straight or Taken?</a>" (2007, two episodes), <a href="Showtime%20%28TV%20network%29">Showtime</a>'s "<a href="Californication%20%28TV%20series%29">Californication</a>", and the pilot episode for "<a href="The%20Defenders%20%282010%20TV%20series%29">The Defenders</a>".
Niles has also appeared in several movies such as "Dire Wolf" (2009), "<a href="Cheerleader%20Massacre%202">Cheerleader Massacre 2</a>" (2011), and the <a href="The%20Twilight%20Saga%20%28film%20series%29">Twilight</a> parody film "Twiharder" (2013).
Modeling.
Niles has been featured in numerous men's magazines such a <a href="Maxim%20%28magazine%29">Maxim</a> (Germany, UK & US editions), <a href="Esquire%20%28magazine%29">Esquire</a> (Turkey), <a href="FHM">FHM</a> (UK), <a href="Complex%20%28magazine%29">Complex</a>, Tandem, and <a href="Hotdog%20Magazine">Hot Dog</a>. She was also featured in the 2005 FastDates.com calendar with <a href="Playboy%20Cybergirl">Playboy Cybergirl</a> <a href="List%20of%20Playboy%20Cyber%20Girls%20of%20the%20Week%232003">Michelle LaVoie</a>. Niles was the cover model for the January/February Germany edition of Maxim.
Appearances.
Niles was a member of "LA Temptation" team in the 2006 <a href="Lingerie%20Bowl">Lingerie Bowl</a>.
Personal life.
Laura Niles was born in Los Angeles. Her ethnic lineage is Russian, British, and Native American (<a href="Nez%20Perce%20tribe">Nez Perce</a>). She received her BA in international relations (<a href="magna%20cum%20laude">magna cum laude</a>), with a minor in Mandarin Chinese, from the <a href="University%20of%20Southern%20California">University of Southern California</a>.
